Posts.Content: cfpmama wrote: Hi everyone, I went to a new Gyn this week, and she felt a thickened area in my left breast and was concerned.  Three years ago my primary doctor found it and sent me for a diagnostic mammogram and ultrasound, and had me consult with a surgeon (not specifically a breast surgeon).  The surgeon basically told me she didn't know why I was there, everything looked fine.  I think I was supposed to follow up but she was so dismissive that I completely forgot about it until my exam this week (prior Gyn didn't mention it at my last appt 18 mos ago).  I've had two routine mammograms since that were normal.  I do have fibrocystic breasts, and have not regularly done BSE's because of that- which I regret now and will change.  When I felt the area with the doctor, I think it may be slightly bigger than three years ago, but I can't say for sure.  My question is, since the surgeon three years ago didn't think anything of this, and the ultrasound and mammograms were negative, is it likely that the thickened area is just how my breast is constructed?  I've been obsessing since the appointment.  My husband has been trying to reassure me that surely it would have caused a problem by now if it were anything serious.   I am going next Wednesday for a diagnostic mammogram and ultrasound at a breast cancer center.     Any thoughts are appreciated- whether reassuring or not  :)  Thanks! Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Persistent thickening- worry? cfpmama cfpmama

Posts.Content: Jul 16, 2011 06:47AM cfpmama wrote: Of course the more I read online the more it sounds to my paranoid self like lobular carcinoma... wishing I had a degree in radiology to make sense of my old mammogram films! Forgot to mention that dr also said my uterus is the size of a ten week pregnancy, she's checking for fibroids and I need an endometrial biopsy. Not aa good week! If the radiologist says no biopsy is needed, should I ask for one for peace of mind, or maybe an MRI? My old report said breasts are heterogeneously dense. Thank you for listening. I just need to get this out and stop dumping on my poor husband.
Posts.Title: Persistent thickening- worry? cfpmama cfpmama
